Posts.Content: I never thought about it but you’re right. It’s like when someone said to me at least you only had 4 chemo I know someone who had 16!! Not helpful. I don’t want sympathy but sometimes you want acknowledgement that you’ve been through a really bloody hard time.  Xxxxx
Posts.Title: "At Least"

Posts.Content: Hi all I finished treatment end of October 2017; had mastectomy (left breast) and reconstruction & Chemo. I feel it’s only now that it’s really hit me that I had cancer! Emotionally it’s hitting me much more now.  I guess cos during treatment I was just trying to get through each day, particularly with chemo as I suffered really badly with side effects. Im not sleeping very well (a side effect of anastrazole I think) and have bad dreams about the cancer coming back. Does anyone else have this? Also even though I tried cold cap, I lost my hair. So look different - which I think is making me feel nervous about going back to work and how people will react. Most of the time I’m pretty positive but some days it is hard. I just wondered how others have found things after treatment and how it was getting back “to normal”. Thanks for listening.
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Thank you Winney and Gail I will take a look at this. xxxx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi I'm on waiting list for Moving Forward course.  I'm thinking about counselling too. Thank you. And big hugs back to you. xx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi I think you're right, it really is take one day at a time. xxx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Thank you.  Big hugs back :) xx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi I had a diep flap reconstruction which was a big op but I'm glad I had it.  (First time I have stayed in hospital ever)!! I know people mean well but when people say about my hair "oh it'll grow back" - I know that! but it doesn't make it any easier.  I loved my hair :( Also there is still pain on my tummy and boob where I had the reconstruction, not bad pain more sore and feels odd cos its numb, that stuff people don't see, you have to deal with on a daily basis.  Also the worry of the cancer coming back - I'm struggling with that at the moment. I feel like its only now it is hitting me - I had cancer !  I'm due to go back to work after Easter, I couldn't work I felt too ill and am really nervous, it feels like starting a new job. It is good to know that others feel the same and that I'm not going mad :) Please babble away we're all hear to listen.  My name is Moira, age 53. Thanks xx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi It's good to know its not just me feeling this way. All the best to you. xxxx
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi I had same issue with water it tasted horrible! I found the only thing that was bearable was orange Capri-sun. In fact when I was off my food I ate Jaffa cakes-must be the orange flavour I guess. All the best. Xxxx
Posts.Title: Drink
